info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 2:28PM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches in the Scott Valley, and 4 to 8 inches in the lower Klamath River Valley and locally more than a feet over the higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph at higher elevations. * WHERE...All of Western Siskiyou County, including Happy Camp, Somes Bar, Fort Jones, Etna, Callahan, Seiad Valley, and Sawyers Bar. Significant impacts are expected for all area roads and highways. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel and the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavier snow amounts are expected above 1500 feet, but significant snow is still expected down to the valley floors. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions.
